hanyu: 再过两坐山就到了，大概还要一个小时吧。
pinyin: zàiguò liǎng zuòshān jiù dào le, dàgài háiyào yígè xiǎoshí ba.
english: It's just two more hills to go and it will be there, probably another hour.

hanyu: 怎么？晕车？这个不行，要加强锻炼哈。
pinyin: zěnme? yùnchē? zhège bùxíng, yào jiāqiángduànliàn hā.
english: What? Car sickness? No, you need to exercise more.

hanyu: 你们是要搬去麟趾镇吧？那地方成里人能住得惯吗？
pinyin: nǐmen shì yào bān qù lín zhǐ zhèn ba? nà dìfāng chénglǐ rénnéng zhù dé guàn ma?
english: Are you going to move to Linzhi Town? Can the people there get used to living there?

hanyu: 也不是不好，只是太闭塞年轻人都住那。
pinyin: yě búshi bùhǎo, zhǐshì tài bìsè niánqīngrén dōu zhù nà.
english: It's not that it's bad, it's just too isolated and young people live there.

hanyu: 据说在古代这个地方很繁华，当地人超有钱。
pinyin: jùshuō zài gǔdài zhège dìfāng hěn fánhuá, dāngdìrén chāo yǒuqián.
english: It is said that this place was very prosperous in ancient times and the locals were super rich.
Because it is rich in silk.

hanyu: 一条街的缫丝工坊能养活一个镇的人。
pinyin: yītiáojiē de sāosī gōngfáng néng yǎnghuo yígè zhèn de rén.
english: A street of silk reeling workshops can support the population of an entire town.

hanyu: 就是把蚕蛹放沸水里煮，然后抽出丝来卷成丝卷。
pinyin: jiùshì bǎ cányǒng fàng fèishuǐ lǐ zhǔ, ránhòu chōuchū sīlái juǎn chéngsījuǎn.
english: It is to boil the silkworm pupae in boiling water, then extract the silk and roll it into silk rolls.

hanyu: 那······那蚕蛹不会觉得热吗？
pinyin: nà······nà cányǒng bùhuì juéde rè ma?
english: Then...won't the silkworm pupae feel hot?

hanyu: 热，当然会热嘛，哈哈。快看,到了到了。
pinyin: rè, dāngrán huì rè ma, hāhā. kuài kàn, dào le dào le.
english: It's hot, of course it's hot, haha. Look, here we are.

hanyu: 林姐，你看书柜靠南墙行吗？
pinyin: línjiě, nǐ kàn shūguì kàonán qiángxíng ma?
english: Sister Lin, do you think it's okay to place the bookcase against the south wall?

hanyu: 行，真是太麻烦你们烦了。
pinyin: xíng, zhēnshitài máfan nǐmen fán le.
english: Okay, sorry to bother you guys so much.

hanyu: 客气啥, 省里说派你和莫老师下来指导，可把我们高兴坏了。
pinyin: kèqi shá,   shěnglǐ shuō pài nǐ hé mò lǎoshī xiàlai zhǐdǎo, kě bǎ wǒmen gāoxìng huài le.
english: Don't be so polite. The provincial government said they would send you and Teacher Mo down here to give us some guidance. We are so happy.

hanyu: 那群家伙闲着，尽管使唤吧。
pinyin: nàqún jiāhuo xiánzhe, jǐnguǎn shǐhuan ba.
english: Those guys are idle, so feel free to use them.

pinyin: hāhā, nà wǒ jiù bù kèqi le.

hanyu: 就怕你们两个大专家住不惯这乡下地方呢。
pinyin: jiù pà nǐmen liǎnggè dà zhuānjiā zhù bùguàn zhè xiāngxia dìfāng ne.
english: I'm worried that you two great experts may not be able to get used to living in this countryside area.

hanyu: 做我们这行的怎可能对住处挑剔。
pinyin: zuò wǒmen zhèxíng de zěn kěnéng duì zhùchù tiāoti.
english: How can we, in our line of work, be picky about where we live?

hanyu: 说起来，我祖上也曾在这小镇上住过呢。
pinyin: shuō qǐlai, wǒ zǔshàng yě céng zài zhè xiǎozhèn shàngzhù guò ne.
english: Come to think of it, my ancestors also lived in this town.

hanyu: 那是小语吧？多大了？真可爱！
pinyin: nà shì xiǎoyǔ ba? duōdà le? zhēn kěài!
english: Is that Xiaoyu? How old is she? So cute!
I want to get off the bus and walk around.

hanyu: 别给叔叔阿姨添乱，在这里等。
pinyin: bié gěi shūshu āyí tiānluàn, zài zhèlǐ děng.
english: Don't cause trouble for your uncle and aunt, just wait here.

hanyu: 妈妈收拾好了就叫你，乖乖的，明白吗？
pinyin: māma shōushi hǎo le jiù jiào nǐ, guāiguāi de, míngbai ma?
english: Mom will call you when she has finished cleaning up. Be good, do you understand?

hanyu: 新家啊······反正也住不过一年吧。
pinyin: xīnjiā a······fǎnzhèng yě zhù bùguò yīnián ba.
english: As for the new home...I won't live in it for more than a year anyway.

pinyin: nǐ jiàn guò le? dǎzhāohu le méi?
english: Have you met him? Have you said hello?

hanyu: 是沈伯伯和他儿子。下次要记得打招呼，太害羞了没礼貌哦。
pinyin: shì shěn bóbo hé tā érzi. xiàcì yào jìde dǎzhāohu, tài hàixiū le méi lǐmào ó.
english: It's Uncle Shen and his son. Remember to say hello next time. It's rude to be shy.

hanyu: 小语的入学手续出了一点问题，学校说得家长亲自去。
pinyin: xiǎoyǔ de rùxué shǒuxù chū le yīdiǎn wèntí, xuéxiào shuō dé jiāzhǎng qīnzì qù.
english: There was a problem with Xiaoyu's admission procedures, and the school asked the parents to go in person.

hanyu: 莫老师抽不出身，叫我来找您。
pinyin: mò lǎoshī chōubùchū shēn, jiào wǒ lái zhǎo nín.
english: Teacher Mo is too busy to come, so he asked me to come and see you.

hanyu: 真是太麻烦你了，我这就过去，稍等会儿。
pinyin: zhēnshitài máfan nǐ le, wǒ zhè jiù guòqù, shāo děnghuìer.
english: Thank you for your help. I'll be there right away. Please wait a moment.
Xiaoyu, Mom has to go out.

hanyu: 这是新家的钥匙，好好收着。
pinyin: zhèshì xīnjiā de yàoshi, hǎohǎo shōuzhe.
english: This is the key to your new home, keep it safe.
Don't go out until I come back.
So it's not that I'm disobedient!

hanyu: 中午怎么一个人都没有······
pinyin: zhōngwǔ zěnme yígè rén dōu méiyǒu······
english: Why is there no one at noon?

hanyu: 好老的房子，这就是爸爸说的“明清建筑”？
pinyin: hǎo lǎo de fángzi, zhè jiùshì bàba shuō de “ míngqīng jiànzhù ”?
english: What an old house, is this the “Ming and Qing Dynasty building” that my dad mentioned?

pinyin: yuánlái shì ézi, xià wǒ yī tiào.
english: It turned out to be a moth, which scared me.
What is my sister looking for?
My sister came in to play.
How old is your sister this year?

pinyin: gēn pópo ná táng chī hǎobuhǎo?
english: How about asking mother-in-law for some candy?
Why is it so hot and stuffy?

pinyin: nǐjiā rén zài dàochù zhǎo nǐ.
english: Your family is looking for you everywhere.

hanyu: 老街这边平时没人会来。
english: Usually no one comes to the old street.

hanyu: 可是，刚才有个老婆婆叫我进去玩啊。
pinyin: kěshì, gāngcái yǒugè lǎopópó jiào wǒ jìnqù wán a.
english: But just now an old lady asked me to come in and play.
But no one has lived here for a long time.

hanyu: 这条街以前家家养蚕，自从有了就街工厂就荒废了。
pinyin: zhètiáo jiē yǐqián jiājiā yǎngcán, zìcóng yǒu le jiù jiē gōngchǎng jiù huāngfèi le.
english: Every family on this street used to raise silkworms, but it has been abandoned since the factory was built.

hanyu: 你后面这旁子以前是煮茧的工坊，早就没人住了。
pinyin: nǐ hòumiàn zhèpángzi yǐqián shì zhǔ jiǎn de gōngfáng, zǎojiù méirénzhù le.
english: The area behind you used to be a cocoon-boiling workshop, but no one has lived there for a long time.

hanyu: 以后别乱跑了，不是每次都有人路过的。
pinyin: yǐhòu bié luànpǎo le, búshi měicì dōu yǒurén lùguò de.
english: Don't run around anymore in the future, there won't be people passing by every time.

hanyu: 对了，哥哥怎么知道我的名字？
pinyin: duì le, gēge zěnme zhīdào wǒ de míngzi?
english: By the way, how did you know my name, brother?

hanyu: 你妈妈一直在找你，整条街都知道了。
pinyin: nǐ māma yīzhí zài zhǎo nǐ, zhěngtiáo jiē dōu zhīdào le.
english: Your mother has been looking for you, and the whole street knows it.

hanyu: 语言的语，一点都不好听。
pinyin: yǔyán de yǔ, yīdiǎn dōu bùhǎo tīng.
english: The language is not pleasant at all.

hanyu: 不会，这是个很好的名字。
pinyin: bùhuì, zhè shì gè hěn hǎo de míngzi.

hanyu: 语言的力量，可比你想家的要大得多。
pinyin: yǔyán de lìliang, kěbǐ nǐ xiǎngjiā de yào dàdéduō.
english: The power of language is much greater than your homesickness.

hanyu: 虽然不太懂，但是听起来好像很厉害。
pinyin: suīrán bùtàidǒng, dànshì tīng qǐlai hǎoxiàng hěn lìhai.
english: I don't quite understand it, but it sounds amazing.

pinyin: yǐhòu bié luànpǎo jiù duì le.

english: It would be strange if the fever reached 38.5 degrees and was not hot!

hanyu: 才一个转身就出去淘气！你知道我找你找了多久？
pinyin: cái yígè zhuǎnshēn jiù chūqù táoqì! nǐ zhīdào wǒ zhǎo nǐ zhǎo le duōjiǔ?
english: You just turned around and went out to do something naughty! Do you know how long I have been looking for you?
After taking the medicine, change into pajamas.

hanyu: 蚕吐丝是因为要给我们做衣服吗？
pinyin: cán tǔsī shìyīnwèi yào gěi wǒmen zuò yīfu ma?
english: Do silkworms spin silk to make clothes for us?

hanyu: 说什么无私奉献，只是人类一厢情愿的想法罢了。
pinyin: shuō shénme wúsīfèngxiàn, zhǐshì rénlèi yīxiāngqíngyuàn de xiǎngfǎ bàle.
english: Talking about selfless dedication is just wishful thinking of human beings.

hanyu: 对它们来说，人类才是掠夺者吧。
pinyin: duì tāmen láishuō, rénlèi cái shì lüèduózhě ba.

hanyu: 这从指尖传来的灼热感······
pinyin: zhè cóng zhǐjiān chuánlái de zhuórègǎn······
english: This burning sensation coming from my fingertips...

hanyu: 是在涕泣那抽丝剥茧的绝望吗？
pinyin: shì zài tìqì nà chōusībāojiǎn de juéwàng ma?
english: Are you weeping over the despair of unraveling the mystery?

hanyu: 在这个故事里的麟趾镇，是真实存在的，至少真实存在过。
pinyin: zài zhège gùshì lǐ de lín zhǐ zhèn, shì zhēnshí cúnzài de, zhìshǎo zhēnshí cúnzài guò.
english: The Linzhi Town in this story really exists, or at least has existed.

hanyu: 在我家乡深山和水流交汇的地方，往往会有这样的小镇。那里时间和空间似乎都是模糊的······就像比“古老”这个字眼还古老的大山一样。
pinyin: zài wǒ jiāxiāng shēnshān hé shuǐliú jiāohuì de dìfāng, wǎngwǎng huì yǒu zhèyàng de xiǎozhèn. nàli shíjiān hé kōngjiān sìhū dōu shì móhu de······jiù xiàng bǐ “ gǔlǎo ” zhège zìyǎn hái gǔlǎo de dàshān yīyàng.
english: In my hometown, where the mountains and rivers meet, there are often small towns like this, where time and space seem to be blurred... just like the mountains that are older than the word "ancient".

hanyu: 小时候，因为父母工作的关系我一直住在祖父母家。有一年老人家身体特别不好，于是父母无奈把我接到了身边，当时他们就在一个这样的古镇，进行着古建筑修复的工作。当时我六岁。
pinyin: xiǎoshíhou, yīnwèi fùmǔ gōngzuò de guānxi wǒ yīzhí zhù zài zǔfùmǔ jiā. yǒu yīnián lǎorénjiā shēntǐ tèbié bùhǎo, yúshì fùmǔ wúnài bǎ wǒ jiēdào le shēnbiān, dāngshí tāmen jiù zài yígè zhèyàng de gǔzhèn, jìnxíng zhe gǔjiànzhù xiūfù de gōngzuò. dāngshí wǒ liùsuì.
english: When I was a child, I lived with my grandparents because of my parents' work. One year, the old man was in very poor health, so my parents had no choice but to take me to live with them. At that time, they were in such an ancient town, doing the work of restoring ancient buildings. I was six years old at that time.

hanyu: 那个小镇民风淳朴，整个格局和建筑都非常古老。父母在我上了两天镇上的小学后还是决定让我在家自学。我如蒙大赦欢欣无比地一头扎进了自己的神仙世界。那个时候······母亲身上的香味和微笑，总是外出的父亲的样子都模模糊糊······而响彻夏季的蝉鸣和模板的居所以及永远有一部分在强烈阴影中的老街道却清晰无比。
pinyin: nàge xiǎozhèn mínfēng chúnpǔ, zhěnggè géjú hé jiànzhù dōu fēicháng gǔlǎo. fùmǔ zài wǒ shàng le liǎngtiān zhènshàng de xiǎoxué hòu háishi juédìng ràng wǒ zàijiā zìxué. wǒ rúméng dàshè huānxīn wúbǐ dì yītóu zhājìn le zìjǐ de shénxiān shìjiè. nàge shíhou······mǔqīn shēnshang de xiāngwèi hé wēixiào, zǒngshì wàichū de fùqīn de yàngzi dōu mómóhúhú······ér xiǎngchè xiàjì de chánmíng hé múbǎn de jūsuǒ yǐjí yǒngyuǎn yǒu yībùfen zài qiángliè yīnyǐng zhōng de lǎo jiēdào què qīngxī wúbǐ.
english: The folk customs of that town were simple, and the whole structure and architecture were very old. After I attended the town's primary school for two days, my parents decided to let me study at home. I was so happy that I plunged into my own fairyland as if I had been pardoned. At that time... the fragrance and smile of my mother, the appearance of my father who was always away were all vague... but the cicadas chirping in the summer, the model's residence, and the old streets that were always partially in the strong shadow were extremely clear.

hanyu: 在那个小镇上，发生什么都是理所当然的，我现在还这样坚持认为。
pinyin: zài nàge xiǎozhèn shàng, fāshēng shénme dōu shì lǐsuǒdāngrán de, wǒ xiànzài hái zhèyàng jiānchí rènwéi.
english: In that small town, everything that happened was taken for granted, and I still believe that.

hanyu: 我童年中一半梦境一半真实，一半模糊一半清晰的一年，就这么拉开了帷幕。
pinyin: wǒ tóngnián zhōng yībàn mèngjìng yībàn zhēnshí, yībàn móhu yībàn qīngxī de yīnián, jiù zhème lākāi le wéimù.
english: A year in my childhood that was half dream and half reality, half blurry and half clear, thus began.

hanyu: 古建筑修复的工作很有趣，我大把大把的时间都蹲在园子里看着叔叔阿姨们把半埋在地里的石狮子和小兽们挖出来，摆放在该在的位置，大人们转过身，它们鼓鼓的眼睛就瞪向我。“我才不怕”，六岁的小孩眼神回敬。
pinyin: gǔjiànzhù xiūfù de gōngzuò hěn yǒuqù, wǒ dàbǎdàbǎ de shíjiān dōu dūn zài yuánzi lǐ kànzhe shūshu āyí men bǎ bàn mái zài dìlǐ de shíshīzi hé xiǎoshòu men wāchūlái, bǎifàng zài gāi zài de wèizhi, dà rénmen zhuǎnguòshēn, tāmen gǔgǔde yǎnjing jiù dèng xiàng wǒ. “ wǒ cái bùpà ”, liùsuì de xiǎohái yǎnshén huíjìng.
english: The work of restoring ancient buildings is very interesting. I spent a lot of time squatting in the garden watching uncles and aunts dig out the stone lions and small animals half buried in the ground and put them in their proper places. When the adults turned around, they stared at me with bulging eyes. "I'm not afraid," the six-year-old child responded with his eyes.

hanyu: 但不知为何，园子里最老的那棵榕树下的石碑孔子像却把我吓得嚎啕大哭，知道离开的那天仍不敢正视。据说那是明代的。
pinyin: dàn bùzhī wèihé, yuánzi lǐ zuì lǎo de nà kē róngshùxià de shíbēi kǒngzǐxiàng què bǎ wǒ xià dé háotáodàkū, zhīdào líkāi de nàtiān réng bùgǎn zhèngshì. jùshuō nà shì míngdài de.
english: But for some reason, the stone statue of Confucius under the oldest banyan tree in the garden frightened me so much that I cried loudly. I dared not look at it until the day I left. It is said to be from the Ming Dynasty.

hanyu: 说起这个，还有一件有趣的事。
pinyin: shuōqǐ zhège, háiyǒu yījiàn yǒuqù de shì.
english: Speaking of this, there is another interesting thing.

hanyu: 园子里竹林很多，光线充足的白日，眯上眼睛就像是凝固在翡翠中一样。而夜里就不那么风雅了······偏偏去卫生间的小路两面都是竹林，夜风里沙沙的影子和声响足以让一个父母不在家的小孩不敢如厕。有那么一段时间，在转角的一丛竹林处，我每次路过总会觉得“有什么在看我”······视线长长短短，粘在后背。一次两次，每每如此，眼角余光总觉得看到些什么，回头找时又什么都没有。终于有一天······实在忍不住猛回头，果然有两个白白小小的东西躲在竹子后面。
pinyin: yuánzi lǐ zhúlín hěnduō, guāngxiàn chōngzú de báirì, mīshàng yǎnjing jiù xiàngshì nínggù zài fěicuì zhōng yīyàng. ér yèli jiù bù nàme fēngyǎ le······piānpiān qù wèishēngjiān de xiǎolù liǎngmiàn dōu shì zhúlín, yèfēng lǐ shāshā de yǐngzi hé shēngxiǎng zúyǐ ràng yígè fùmǔ bù zàijiā de xiǎohái bùgǎn rúcè. yǒu nàme yīduànshíjiān, zài zhuǎnjiǎo de yī cóngzhúlín chù, wǒ měicì lùguò zǒnghuì juéde “ yǒu shénme zài kàn wǒ ”······shìxiàn chángchángduǎnduǎn, zhān zài hòubèi. yīcì liǎngcì, měiměirúcǐ, yǎnjiǎo yúguāng zǒng juéde kàndào xiē shénme, huítóu zhǎoshí yòu shénme dōu méiyǒu. zhōngyú yǒu yītiān······shízài rěnbuzhù měnghuítóu, guǒrán yǒu liǎnggè báibái xiǎoxiǎode dōngxī duǒ zài zhúzi hòumiàn.
english: There are many bamboo forests in the garden. During the day when the light is abundant, if you squint your eyes, you will feel as if you are frozen in emerald. But it is not so elegant at night... The path to the bathroom is surrounded by bamboo forests on both sides. The rustling shadows and sounds in the night wind are enough to make a child who is not at home afraid to go to the bathroom. There was a period of time when I always felt that "something is looking at me" every time I passed by a bamboo forest at the corner... The sight was long and short, sticking to my back. Once or twice, every time it happened, I always felt that I saw something out of the corner of my eye, but when I turned around to look, there was nothing. Finally one day... I couldn't help but look back, and sure enough, there were two small white things hiding behind the bamboo.
Jump up, push aside the bamboo branches, that is...
